Subjective: Fatigue x 2 months. Tired all day, wake up tired. Sleep superficial. No clear cause or acute onset. Work impacted, don't do anything after work, rest on weekends. Exercise possible (climbing, cycling), no significant deterioration. Increased muscle pain, more than usual back pain. Morning stiffness present. Startling awakenings reported by wife (1x/week, lifelong). Hay fever symptoms controlled with meds. Abdomen slightly uncomfortable on palpation, no sharp pain. No fever, cough, SOB, palpitations, chest pain, weight loss, bowel/bladder changes, joint pain (hands/feet). Father had back problems. Request: Blood tests for anemia, thyroid, inflammation; rule out rheumatism. Concern: 'Is there something wrong with my body?'
Objective: Vitals: BP 110/60, HR 40-50 (athletic), RR normal, Temp normal. Lungs: Clear. Back: No vertebral tenderness, mild tenderness next to midline lower back, long back muscles feel good, no L/R asymmetry. Neck/Shoulders: Supple, no pain. Abdomen: Bowel sounds active, tympanic to percussion, supple, slightly uncomfortable on palpation but no sharp pain. No gross abnormalities noted.
Assessment: Fatigue, unspecified cause. Differential includes anemia, hypothyroidism, inflammatory process. Back pain, likely musculoskeletal. Hay fever, controlled.
Plan:
1. Blood tests: CBC (anemia), TSH (thyroid), ESR/CRP (inflammation).
2. Patient to call day after results available.
3. Schedule phone appointment to discuss results and next steps.
4. Provide form for blood tests at Atal Medial.
